instructions.text: Picking the Mounting Bracket: Take MOUNTING_BRACKET_ASSEMBLY.
instructions.picture_description: A close-up image of a mounting bracket resting on a surface.

instructions.text: Insert the BUTTON_EXTENSION for the reset button into the MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Two images showing a hand holding a device part with the BUTTON_EXTENSION being inserted.

instructions.text: Insert Motor with flexible PCBA halfway into the main body.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a hand holding a motor with a flexible PCBA, partially inserted into the housing.

instructions.text: Insert button extension halfway into the main body.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the button extension positioned to be pushed into the housing.

instructions.text: Afterwards, the motor can be pushed down to its final position as well as the button extension.
Attach the motor and PCBA to the housing by inserting the two MOTOR_SCREWs.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the back side of the housing with the motor in place and visible screw holes.

instructions.text: Insert MOUNTING_BUTTON_EXTENSION for the mounting button into MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: Image shows a hand inserting a mounting button extension into a main body.

instructions.text: Put GEAR into the opening of the rotary encoder on PPCBA.
instructions.picture_description: Image shows a gear being placed into the rotary encoder on a PCB.

instructions.text: Place the PPCBA in the Main Body
instructions.picture_description: A person is placing a circuit board into a main housing.

instructions.text: Insert PCB_SCREWs
instructions.picture_description: A hand is inserting screws into a circuit board within a housing.

instructions.text:
Checking Mounting Quality
Make sure the PCB cannot move at all after the insertion of the screws.
instructions.picture_description: Images showing how to check the PCB mounting quality.

instructions.text:
Connecting Flexible PCB to PPCBA
1. Put the flex PCB into the connector.
2. Flip the fastener to lock the PCB.
instructions.picture_description: Images displaying the connection process of the flexible PCB to the PPCBA.

instructions.text:
Positioning the White Sticker
Place the WHITE STICKER on the back of the flexible PCB.
Scanning of PCBA Serial
instructions.picture_description: Image showing the PCBA and the location of the serial number on the device.

instructions.text: Scan EMS assigned PCBA serial number (sticker or engraved).
Print the DEVICE_LABEL in accordance with the label printing instructions DEVICE_LABEL_LPI.
instructions.picture_description: A printer printing device labels.

instructions.text: Attach the printed DEVICE_LABEL into the back of the main body.
instructions.picture_description: The back of a device with a printed label being attached.

instructions.text: Position the flexible PCBA in display area using the yellow marked 2 locators. Make sure the FPCBA slides under the green marked edge.
instructions.picture_description: A person positioning a flexible PCB in a device with marked edges.

instructions.text: Positioning the Light Blocker
instructions.picture_description: A device's light blocker is being attached, showing a close-up of the device with hands positioning it.

instructions.text: Position the LIGHT_BLOCKER in display area using the 2 locators.
Attention: LIGHT_BLOCKER differs depending on target SKU.
Push DISPLAY_RING onto MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: A hand pushing the display ring onto the main body of the device.

instructions.text: Attach BATTERY_COVER to MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: A hand holding the battery cover while attaching it to the main body of the device.

instructions.text: Put HINGE into hole to hold the BATTERY_COVER.
instructions.picture_description: A person holding a device with a hinge aligned with a battery cover.

instructions.text: Push the DISPLAY_RING completely down.
instructions.picture_description: A person pushing down a display ring on a device.

instructions.text: Push the WHEEL onto the main body.
instructions.picture_description: A hand pushing a wheel onto a device's main body.

instructions.text: Snap the FRONT_CAP onto the MAIN_BODY.
instructions.picture_description: A hand snapping the front cap onto the main body, ensuring proper alignment.

instructions.text: Print the SETUP_LABEL in accordance with the label printing instructions SETUP_LABEL_LPI.
instructions.picture_description: A label printer printing setup labels, with a visible label on the output.

instructions.text: Place the SETUP_LABEL on the WHEEL.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing a device with a labeled setup position, displaying both horizontal and vertical orientations.

instructions.text: Remove the Mounting Bracket
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the mounting bracket being removed.

instructions.text: Scan the Rear Serial Number. The station starts the EOL procedure.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing the rear of the device with a serial number and QR code.

instructions.text: Scan the Front Serial Number
instructions.picture_description: An image of a device with a visible QR code for scanning.

instructions.text:
Insert Batteries

1. Open the battery compartment cover.
2. Insert the AA BATTERIES.
3. Close the battery compartment cover.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a hand inserting batteries into a device.

instructions.text:
Wait for EOL on display.
1) If DUT shows FAIL, don't proceed, station should show FAIL.
instructions.picture_description: A device held in hand displaying the message EOL.

instructions.text:
Press the pairing button.
1) DUT shows 00.
instructions.picture_description: The back of a device showing a circular button and an indicator for DUT status.

instructions.text:
Turn the wheel to the right until all LEDs turn on
1) DUT counts up
2) DUT turns on all LEDs above maximum
instructions.picture_description: A hand turning a wheel on a device which displays '88P' and has an arrow pointing to the right.

instructions.text:
Turn the wheel to the left until all LEDs turn off
1) DUT counts down
2) DUT turns off all LEDs below minimum
instructions.picture_description: A hand turning a wheel on a device which shows an arrow pointing to the left.

instructions.text: Attach the Mounting Bracket
instructions.picture_description: A circular mounting bracket.

instructions.text:
Mount DUT using its adapter on the stand
1) DUT shows CAL.
2) DUT performs calibration
instructions.picture_description: A device mounted on a stand showing 'CAL' on its display.

instructions.text:
Wait for PA or FA on DUT
1) The station should show PASS or FAIL
instructions.picture_description: A display showing the statuses 'PA' (PASS) and 'FA' (FAIL), with a checkmark next to 'PA'.

instructions.text: Remove DUT from stand
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a device under test (DUT) being removed from its stand.

instructions.text: Remove the Mounting Bracket from the device main body.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing the mounting bracket of the device.

instructions.text: Open & Close the battery cover to interrupt the power supply.
instructions.picture_description: Image showing the interior of the device with the battery compartment.

instructions.text: Checking for Customer Mode: Check that the display shows the temperature when turning the wheel. Attention: If the device shows 'EOL', the EOL test has not been completed.
instructions.picture_description: Two images: one showing a display with a temperature of 22Ã‚Â°, and another showing a display with 'WRONG'.

instructions.text: Placing the Battery Tab: Open the battery compartment again. Place the BATTERY_TAB as shown. Close the battery compartment cover back. Attention: The battery tab must break the electric contact.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a person placing the battery tab inside the battery compartment.

instructions.text: Close battery door
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a device with a battery door and an arrow indicator for closing it.

instructions.text: Check Wheel on Torque Meter - Max allowed: 40mNm
instructions.picture_description: An image of a torque meter with a wheel indicator.

instructions.text: Wrap the Device(s) in PROTECTIVE_FOIL.
instructions.picture_description: An image showing a hand holding a device that appears to be in the process of being wrapped in foil.

instructions.text:
Get between the Front Cap and the Wheel with a plastic tool at the red marked area.
Note: DO NOT USE METAL. It will damage the wheel.
instructions.picture_description: A plastic tool is shown inserted between the Front Cap and the Wheel.

instructions.text: Push the Front Cap up with the plastic tool until the lift side is fully lifted.
instructions.picture_description: The Front Cap is being pushed up with a plastic tool.

instructions.text: Now you can pull up the Front Cap with your hands. Throw the Front Cap away.
instructions.picture_description: The Front Cap is being pulled off with hands, revealing internal components.
